subject: Design
title: Flat Design: The End of Skeuomorphism
description: A quick, practical guide to Flat Design: The End of Skeuomorphism.

hook.text: For years, digital buttons had shadows and textures mimicking real objects. Then Microsoft went flat.

buildup.text: Windows 8's Metro design stripped away all fake depth â€” just color, type, and clean edges.

discovery.text: Apple followed with iOS 7. Overnight, the leather textures and glossy buttons vanished.

twist.text: Users hated it at first. Designers loved it. Within a year, flat design became the new standard.

climax.text: Flat design proved that once users are comfortable with screens, metaphors become clutter.

punchline.text: Design evolves when users outgrow the training wheels.

quiz.question: What did flat design eliminate?
options: Realistic textures and shadows mimicking physical objects
